task_summary: The robot identifies the towel, approaches it, and verifies arrival.

task_long_description.overview: This episode involves a bimanual robotic arm executing a reach-to-towel behavior. The workspace includes a pink towel placed atop a green mat, likely on a tabletop. The goal is for the robot’s right arm to perceive the towel, move directly over it, and verify its proximity without grasping or manipulating it. Constraints are dictated by precise approach and non-contact until arrival confirmation.
preconditions: Towel is visible and unobstructed on the workspace
Robot arm is initialized and above the workspace
No obstacles between gripper and towel
stepwise_plan: Move the end effector towards the towel using coordinates/symbolic target
Verify that the end effector has reached the towel
success_criteria: End effector is at or above the towel
All subtasks complete in the correct order
failure_and_recovery: Towel not detected: retry or abort
Motion planning error: stop and alert operator
False positive in arrival verification: retry detection
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates when arrival at the towel is verified.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Detect the towel on the workspace using perception with an 800ms timeout.
Move the end effector towards the detected towel with a 1500ms timeout.
Check if the end effector is at the towel.

recovery_strategy: Retry movement or alert on failure
Confirm IsAt using redundant cues or perception
assumptions: No grasp or manipulation occurs; episodes show approach only
The towel is not moved or disturbed
Instruction asks for reach only, no grasp

expected_success_criteria: Robot’s end effector is at or above the towel at end of episode
